name: afrobarometer_langs

resources.name: afrobarometer_langs

fields.name: value
fields.title: Afrobarometer language value
fields.description: The integer value of the language in the Afrobarometer dataset, e.g. `1, 2, ....`

fields.name: name
fields.title: Afrobarometer language name
fields.description: The labels of the language variable in the Afrobarometer dataset, for example, `"English", "French", ...`.

fields.name: country
fields.title: Country
fields.description: The country in which the language appears. This is the integer value of the country in the Afrobarometer survey's `country` variable.

fields.name: iso_alpha2
fields.title: Country
fields.description: A two-letter country abbreviation (ISO 3166 alpha-2) for the Afrobarometer country in which the language appears. Unlike the Afrobarometer country variables this is consistent across rounds.

resources.title: Afrobarometer Language Summary
resources.description: For all rounds, variables which included language answers, the integer values and labels of the languages, and the countries in which those languages appeared.

resources.name: afrobarometer_langs_other

fields.name: country
fields.title: Country
fields.description: The country in which the language appears. This is the integer value of the country in the Afrobarometer survey's `country` variable.

fields.name: value
fields.label: Language name
fields.description: Language name. This is the value of the "other" language variable.

fields.name: iso_alpha2
fields.title: Country
fields.description: A two-letter country abbreviation (ISO 3166 alpha-2) for the Afrobarometer country in which the language appears. Unlike the Afrobarometer country variables this is consistent across rounds.

resources.title: Afrobarometer 'Other' Languages
resources.description: Languages mentioned in the text responses after answering "other" to a language question.

resources.name: iso_to_wals

fields.name: iso_code
fields.description: The ISO code of the language being mapped.
fields.label: ISO 639-3 Code From

fields.name: wals_code
fields.label: WALS code
fields.description: The WALS code associated with it.

fields.name: iso_code_to
fields.label: ISO 639-3 Code (WALS)
fields.description: The ISO 639-3 code of the WALS language that was mapped to.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance between the original ISO and the ISO code of the WALS language to which it was mapped. The distance is the graph distance between the two ISO languages in the Ethnologue language tree. A distance of 0 means the ISO language was directly mapped to a WALS language.
fields.label: Distance

fields.name: same_country
fields.description: Only non-missing if this was an automatic match. It is true if the matched WALS language has the same country as the original ISO language.
fields.label: Same country

resources.description: Mappings from all ISO 639-3 languages to a WALS language. These use the ISO 639-3 codes provided in the WALS dataset and the Ethnologue language tree. ISO languages are matched to the closest WALS language using distance on the Ethnologue tree. This mapping is many to many.

resources.name: afrobarometer_to_iso_639_3

fields.name: lang_id
fields.title: Afrobarometer language value
fields.description: The integer value of the language in the Afrobarometer dataset, e.g. `1, 2, ....`

fields.name: lang_name
fields.title: Afrobarometer language name
fields.description: The labels of the language variable in the Afrobarometer dataset, for example, `"English", "French", ...`.

fields.name: country
fields.title: Country
fields.description: The country in which the language appears. This is the integer value of the country in the Afrobarometer survey's `country` variable.

fields.name: iso_alpha2
fields.title: Country
fields.description: A two-letter country abbreviation (ISO 3166 alpha-2) for the Afrobarometer country in which the language appears. Unlike the Afrobarometer country variables this is consistent across rounds.

fields.name: iso_639_3
fields.title: ISO 639-3
fields.description: The ISO 639-3 language code. For example, `"eng"`. Not all languages are mapped, so there can be missing values.

fields.name: iso_ref_name
fields.title: ISO Reference Name
fields.description: The official reference name of the ISO 639-3 language.

fields.name: iso_scope
fields.title: ISO Language Type
fields.description: This is `"I"` if it is an individual language, and `"M"` if it is a macrolanguages (which includes multiple individual languages). See the ISO 639-3 documentation for more on the distinctions between these.

resources.title: Mappings of Afrobarometer Languages to ISO 639-3 Codes
resources.description:
Mappings between Afrobarometer "Other" Languages and the the codes of the ISO 639-3 standard.
These mappings are many-to-many. An Afrobarometer language can map to more than one ISO 639-3 language, and more than one Afrobarometer language can map to the same ISO 639-3 language.

fields.name: value

fields.name: iso_639_3

fields.description: The ISO 639-3 language code. For example, `"eng"`. Not all languages are mapped, so there can be missing values.

fields.name: iso_scope
fields.title: ISO Language Type
fields.description: This is `"I"` if it is an individual language, and `"M"` if it is a macrolanguages (which includes multiple individual languages). See the ISO 639-3 documentation for more on the distinctions between these.

fields.name: iso_ref_name
fields.title: ISO Reference Name
fields.description: The official reference name of the ISO 639-3 language.

fields.name: iso_alpha2

fields.description: A two-letter country abbreviation (ISO 3166 alpha-2) for the Afrobarometer country in which the language appears. Unlike the Afrobarometer country variables this is consistent across rounds.

resources.description: Mappings between Afrobarometer "Other" Languages and the the codes of the ISO 639-3 standard.

resources.name: afrobarometer_to_wals

fields.name: lang_id
fields.title: Afrobarometer language value
fields.description: The integer value of the language in the Afrobarometer dataset, e.g. `1, 2, ....`

fields.name: lang_name
fields.title: Afrobarometer language name
fields.description: The labels of the language variable in the Afrobarometer dataset, for example, `"English", "French", ...`.

fields.name: country
fields.title: Country
fields.description: The country in which the language appears. This is the integer value of the country in the Afrobarometer survey's `country` variable.

fields.name: iso_alpha2
fields.title: Country
fields.description: A two-letter country abbreviation (ISO 3166 alpha-2) for the Afrobarometer country in which the language appears. Unlike the Afrobarometer country variables this is consistent across rounds.

fields.name: wals_code
fields.title: WALS code
fields.description: The three-letter language identifier used by WALS.

fields.name: wals_name
fields.title: WALS Name
fields.description: The language name used by WALS

fields.name: auto
fields.title: Automatched
fields.description: If true, then language was matched to the WALS language using the ISO 639-9 mappings and the ISO-to-WALS mappings in `iso_to_wals`. If false, then the WALS codes were manually entered.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance between the original ISO and the ISO code of the WALS language to which it was mapped. The distance is the graph distance between the two ISO languages in the Ethnologue language tree. A distance of 0 means the ISO language was directly mapped to a WALS language.
fields.label: Distance

fields.name: same_country
fields.description: Only non-missing if this was an automatic match. It is true if the matched WALS language has the same country as the original ISO language.
fields.label: Same country

resources.title: Afrobarometer Language to WALS mappings
resources.description: The WALS languages associated with Afrobarometer languages.

resources.title: Afrobarometer "Other" Languages to WALS
resources.description: The WALS languages associated with the Afrobarometer "Other" languages.

resources.name: wals_dist

fields.name: from
fields.description: WALS langoid from.

fields.name: to
fields.description: WALS langoid to

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The number of ancestors until `from` shares a common linguistic ancestor of `to` on the Ethnologue hierarchy of languages.

resources.title: Ethnologue Linguistic Distances Between WALS langoids
resources.descrioption: For all WALS langoids, use the the WALS to ISO mappings to calculate the linguistic distance between the languids on the Ethnologue tree. This is defined as the number of edges to a common ancestor of two languages. Since the Ethnologue tree is not balanced, the value distance between two languages can depend on the direction.

resources.name: afrobarometer_lang_variables

fields.name: type
fields.description: Does the variable refer to the home language of the the respondent, the language in which the interview was conducted, or the home language of the interviewer.
fields.label: Language variable type

fields.name: other
fields.description: Does the variable refer to the response if the answer is "OTHER".

resources.title: Afrobarometer Language Variables
resources.description: For each Afrobarometer round, the variables with the language of the respondent, interview, or interviewer.

resources.name: afrobarometer_country_variables
resources.title: Afrobarometer Country Variables
resources.description: For each Afrobarometer round, the variable name of the the country of the respondent.

resources.name: afrobarometer_respno_to_langs.csv

fields.name: respno
fields.title: Afrobarometer ID
fields.description: Observation ID in the Afrobarometer dataset. The variable that this is associated with varies with rounds.

resources.title: Afrobarometer Observations to Language Codes
resources.description: Mappings from Afrobarometer observations to ISO 639-3 and WALS language codes.

resources.name: afrobarometer_respno_variables
resources.title: Afrobarometer Respondent ID variables
resources.description: Names of the respondent ID variable in each Afrobarometer round dataset.

sources.name: Afrobarometer Merged Round 5 data (34 countries) (2011-2013) (last update: July 2015)
Afrobarometer ISO 639-3 Complete Code Tables Set (2017-02-17)
The World Atlas of Language Structures Online

title: Afrobarometer Languages Mapped to ISO Standards and WALS
description: Mappings from languages used in the Afrobarometer surveys to some common language standards and databases, the ISO 639-3 langauge codes and the WALS database.
